title.value: Let's find what assistance is available.

markup.content: In response to the recent flooding damage, the city of Detroit has various ways to assist affected residents.
Currently we have 4 available options. Which option would you like to view? If you require assistance, follow the last button.
Did you file an insurance claim?
If you have insurance, you should file a claim with your provider before applying to any other assistance. The deadline to file the flood insurance claim is August 27th.
If you’re covered, you should see something like WATER BACK-UP in your policy.
Great!
Even if you have insurance, they may not cover all of your damage from this event. Check to see the specific flood damage coverage you have.
Also, you can still apply for FEMA assistance even if you have insurance - Keep a copy of your policy, as well as the letter of denial or settlement, as FEMA will ask to see this information.
If you have coverage and FEMA denies you, you can appeal.
Start your FEMA claim
Did you file a DWSD claim?
Give notice to DWSD within 45 days of discovery of damage with:

content.content: Your name, address, and telephone number
Address of your damaged property
Date of discovery and a brief description of the claim
For claims from the June 25-26, 2021 storm, claims must be filed by August 9, 2021
You can also file for damages from later storms, within 45 of those dates

markup.content: You can file your claim by calling:
Or online
Start online claim
Don't forget to also apply for other assistance like FEMA and SBA
See FEMA and SBA process.
Did apply for SBA?

You should complete the SBA application to get the most funding options. If you have applied for FEMA, you will most likely be referred by FEMA to apply for SBA as well. Get a headstart by applying at the same time instead of waiting for a referral from FEMA.
If you have applied for FEMA, you need to complete this application as well.

You do not need to take the loan if approved. You just need to apply. Note: SBA Loans are not just for businesses - they are for everyone. Renters, homeowners, landlords, businesses, nonprofits, and religious organizations are all able to apply for low-interest flexible loans. The deadline to apply for Physical Property Damage loans is September 13, 2021 and the deadline to apply for Economic Injury Disaster Loans (EIDL) loans is April 15, 2021.
Start your SBA application
Remember that you do not need to take the loan if approved
Also, don't forget to apply for FEMA assistance.
Start your FEMA application
You can visit these Disaster Recovery Centers:

content.content: Kemeny Recreation Center (2260 S. Fort Street)
Golightly Career Tech Center (900 Dickerson)

markup.content: Other places that can give you support:

content.content: MDHHS
Red Cross
City of Detroit Community Health Corps
Wayne Metro Community Action Agency
United Way

markup.content: Did you submit a FEMA claim?
FEMA application deadline: September 13th, 2021
You are eligible to apply for FEMA Individual Assistance if:

content.content: You were affected by the June 25-26 floods
Your residence has areas that became unsafe to occupy and live in (risk of mold from standing water, a furnace you had to replace, electrical damage, roof damage)
You have a Social Security number OR a minor child in your household has a SSN

markup.content: You can start your FEMA claim by calling

content.content: 800-462-7585 for those with hearing or speech impairments

markup.content: By visiting any of the Detroit Disaster Recovery Centers (DRC) betweent 7AM to 7PM, 7 days a week.

content.content: Kemeny Recreation Center (2260 S. Fort Street)
Golightly Career Tech Center (900 Dickerson)

markup.content: Or by going online.
Start your FEMA claim online
Did you get denied?
If you are Denied at any point:

content.content: Read your denial letter and identify why you were denied
Gather documents and evidence for your appeal
Write an appeal letter
File your appeal letter, along with your documents online or at Disaster Recovery Center within 60 days of the date on your denial letter.
FEMA makes a final decision within 90 days

markup.content: If you need in-person assistance, please visit any of Detroit Disaster Recovery Centers (DRC) between 7AM to 7PM, 7 days a week.

content.content: Kemeny Recreation Center (2260 S. Fort Street)
Golightly Career Tech Center (900 Dickerson)

markup.content: Glad you are getting the help you need. While you wait for the funds to show, don't forget to apply to other options like insurance, SBA and DWSD.
